tasks.title: Set up FastAPI Application Structure
tasks.description: Create the initial FastAPI application structure with the main entry point and necessary directories.
tasks.details:
Create the following directory structure:
- api/
  - main.py (FastAPI app initialization)
  - models.py (Pydantic models)
  - logic.py (Business logic)
- toolkit/
  - browser.py (StealthBrowserToolkit)
- settings/
  - logger.py (Structured logging)

In main.py, initialize the FastAPI application with appropriate metadata and CORS settings:
```python
from fastapi import FastAPI
from fastapi.middleware.cors import CORSMiddleware

app = FastAPI(
    title="Async Web Fetching Service",
    description="A service for asynchronously fetching web content using stealth browsers",
    version="1.0.0"
)

app.add_middleware(
    CORSMiddleware,
    allow_origins=["*"],
    allow_credentials=True,
    allow_methods=["*"],
    allow_headers=["*"],
)

@app.get("/")
async def root():
    return {"message": "Async Web Fetching Service API"}

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import uvicorn
    uvicorn.run("api.main:app", host="0.0.0.0", port=8000, reload=True)
```

Create a requirements.txt file with the following dependencies:
```
fastapi==0.104.1
uvicorn==0.24.0
pydantic==2.4.2
structlog==23.2.0
patchright==1.0.0  # Replace with actual version
asyncio==3.4.3
python-dotenv==1.0.0
```
tasks.testStrategy: Verify the application structure is created correctly by running the FastAPI application and accessing the root endpoint. Ensure the application starts without errors and returns the expected response.

tasks.title: Implement Pydantic Data Models
tasks.description: Define the Pydantic models for request and response validation as specified in the PRD.
tasks.details:
Create the models.py file with the following Pydantic models:

```python
from typing import List, Optional, Literal
from pydantic import BaseModel, Field, validator

class FetchOptions(BaseModel):
    proxies: List[str] = Field(default_factory=list, description="List of proxy URLs to use for fetching")
    wait_min: int = Field(default=1, ge=0, description="Minimum wait time in seconds between requests")
    wait_max: int = Field(default=3, ge=0, description="Maximum wait time in seconds between requests")
    concurrency_limit: int = Field(default=5, ge=1, le=20, description="Maximum number of concurrent browser instances")
    
    @validator('wait_max')
    def validate_wait_max(cls, v, values):
        if 'wait_min' in values and v < values['wait_min']:
            raise ValueError('wait_max must be greater than or equal to wait_min')
        return v

class FetchRequest(BaseModel):
    links: List[str] = Field(..., min_items=1, description="List of URLs to fetch")
    options: FetchOptions = Field(default_factory=FetchOptions, description="Options for the fetching process")

class JobStatusResponse(BaseModel):
    job_id: str = Field(..., description="Unique identifier for the job")
    status_url: str = Field(..., description="URL to check the status of the job")

class FetchResult(BaseModel):
    url: str = Field(..., description="The URL that was fetched")
    status: Literal["success", "error"] = Field(..., description="Status of the fetch operation")
    html_content: Optional[str] = Field(None, description="The HTML content of the page if successful")
    error_message: Optional[str] = Field(None, description="Error message if the fetch failed")

class FetchResponse(BaseModel):
    job_id: str = Field(..., description="Unique identifier for the job")
    status: Literal["pending", "in_progress", "completed", "failed"] = Field(..., description="Current status of the job")
    results: List[FetchResult] = Field(default_factory=list, description="List of fetch results")
    total_urls: int = Field(..., description="Total number of URLs to fetch")
    completed_urls: int = Field(..., description="Number of URLs that have been processed")
```

tasks.title: Set up Structured Logging with structlog
tasks.description: Configure structlog to output structured JSON logs for all operations.
tasks.details:
Create the logger.py file in the settings directory with the following configuration:

```python
import logging
import sys
import time
from typing import Any, Dict

import structlog

def configure_logging() -> None:
    """Configure structlog for JSON formatted logging"""
    logging.basicConfig(format="%(message)s", stream=sys.stdout, level=logging.INFO)

    structlog.configure(
        processors=[
            structlog.contextvars.merge_contextvars,
            structlog.stdlib.filter_by_level,
            structlog.stdlib.add_logger_name,
            structlog.stdlib.add_log_level,
            structlog.stdlib.PositionalArgumentsFormatter(),
            structlog.processors.TimeStamper(fmt="iso"),
            structlog.processors.StackInfoRenderer(),
            structlog.processors.format_exc_info,
            structlog.processors.UnicodeDecoder(),
            structlog.processors.JSONRenderer()
        ],
        logger_factory=structlog.stdlib.LoggerFactory(),
        wrapper_class=structlog.stdlib.BoundLogger,
        cache_logger_on_first_use=True,
    )

def get_logger(name: str) -> structlog.stdlib.BoundLogger:
    """Get a structured logger with the given name"""
    return structlog.get_logger(name)

# Add context variables for request tracking
def log_request_context(request_id: str, user_agent: str = None) -> None:
    """Add request context to all log entries within this context"""
    structlog.contextvars.clear_contextvars()
    structlog.contextvars.bind_contextvars(
        request_id=request_id,
        user_agent=user_agent,
    )

# Initialize logging when the module is imported
configure_logging()
```

Update main.py to use the structured logger:

```python
from settings.logger import get_logger

logger = get_logger("api.main")

@app.middleware("http")
async def log_requests(request, call_next):
    import uuid
    request_id = str(uuid.uuid4())
    from settings.logger import log_request_context
    log_request_context(request_id, request.headers.get("user-agent"))
    
    start_time = time.time()
    logger.info("Request started", path=request.url.path, method=request.method)
    
    response = await call_next(request)
    
    process_time = time.time() - start_time
    logger.info(
        "Request completed",
        path=request.url.path,
        method=request.method,
        status_code=response.status_code,
        process_time_ms=round(process_time * 1000, 2)
    )
    
    return response
```

tasks.title: Implement StealthBrowserToolkit Integration
tasks.description: Create the StealthBrowserToolkit class in the toolkit module to manage browser instances for fetching web content.
tasks.details:
Create the browser.py file in the toolkit directory with the following implementation:

```python
import asyncio
import random
from typing import Dict, List, Optional, Union

from settings.logger import get_logger

# Assuming Patchright is a Python package that provides browser automation
# If it's a different interface, adjust accordingly
from patchright import Browser, BrowserContext, Page

class StealthBrowserToolkit:
    """A toolkit for managing stealth browser instances for web scraping."""
    
    def __init__(self, headless: bool = True):
        self.headless = headless
        self.logger = get_logger("toolkit.browser")
        self._browser: Optional[Browser] = None
    
    async def initialize(self) -> None:
        """Initialize the browser instance."""
        if self._browser is None:
            self.logger.info("Initializing browser", headless=self.headless)
            # Assuming Patchright has a similar API to Playwright
            # Adjust based on actual Patchright API
            self._browser = await Browser.launch(headless=self.headless)
    
    async def create_context(self, proxy: Optional[str] = None) -> BrowserContext:
        """Create a new browser context, optionally with a proxy."""
        await self.initialize()
        
        context_options = {}
        if proxy:
            self.logger.info("Using proxy", proxy=proxy)
            context_options["proxy"] = {"server": proxy}
        
        # Add stealth settings to avoid detection
        context_options.update({
            "user_agent": "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/118.0.0.0 Safari/537.36",
            "viewport": {"width": 1920, "height": 1080},
            "has_touch": False,
            "is_mobile": False,
            "locale": "en-US",
            "timezone_id": "America/New_York",
        })
        
        context = await self._browser.new_context(**context_options)
        return context
    
    async def fetch_url(self, url: str, proxy: Optional[str] = None, wait_time: int = 2) -> Dict[str, Union[str, bool]]:
        """Fetch a URL using a stealth browser and return the HTML content."""
        result = {
            "url": url,
            "success": False,
            "html": None,
            "error": None
        }
        
        context = None
        page = None
        
        try:
            self.logger.info("Fetching URL", url=url, proxy=proxy)
            context = await self.create_context(proxy)
            page = await context.new_page()
            
            # Navigate to the URL
            response = await page.goto(url, wait_until="networkidle")
            if not response or response.status >= 400:
                result["error"] = f"Failed to load page: HTTP {response.status if response else 'unknown'}"
                return result
            
            # Wait for the page to be fully loaded
            await asyncio.sleep(wait_time)
            
            # Get the HTML content
            html = await page.content()
            result["html"] = html
            result["success"] = True
            
            self.logger.info("Successfully fetched URL", url=url, content_length=len(html))
            return result
            
        except Exception as e:
            error_message = str(e)
            self.logger.error("Error fetching URL", url=url, error=error_message)
            result["error"] = error_message
            return result
            
        finally:
            # Clean up resources
            if page:
                await page.close()
            if context:
                await context.close()
    
    async def close(self) -> None:
        """Close the browser instance and free resources."""
        if self._browser:
            self.logger.info("Closing browser")
            await self._browser.close()
            self._browser = None
    
    async def __aenter__(self):
        await self.initialize()
        return self
    
    async def __aexit__(self, exc_type, exc_val, exc_tb):
        await self.close()
```

This implementation provides a clean interface for creating browser instances, navigating to URLs, and handling cleanup. It's designed to work with the Patchright browser automation library and includes stealth features to avoid detection.

tasks.title: Implement In-Memory Job Store
tasks.description: Create the in-memory job store using a Python dictionary to track job states and results.
tasks.details:
Update the logic.py file to implement the in-memory job store:

```python
import asyncio
import uuid
from datetime import datetime
from typing import Dict, List, Optional

from settings.logger import get_logger
from api.models import FetchRequest, FetchResponse, FetchResult

logger = get_logger("api.logic")

# In-memory job store
jobs: Dict[str, Dict] = {}

def create_job(request: FetchRequest) -> str:
    """Create a new job and return its ID."""
    job_id = str(uuid.uuid4())
    
    jobs[job_id] = {
        "id": job_id,
        "status": "pending",
        "created_at": datetime.utcnow().isoformat(),
        "updated_at": datetime.utcnow().isoformat(),
        "request": request.dict(),
        "results": [],
        "total_urls": len(request.links),
        "completed_urls": 0
    }
    
    logger.info("Created new job", job_id=job_id, total_urls=len(request.links))
    return job_id

def get_job_status(job_id: str) -> Optional[FetchResponse]:
    """Get the current status of a job."""
    if job_id not in jobs:
        return None
    
    job = jobs[job_id]
    
    return FetchResponse(
        job_id=job_id,
        status=job["status"],
        results=[FetchResult(**result) for result in job["results"]],
        total_urls=job["total_urls"],
        completed_urls=job["completed_urls"]
    )

def update_job_status(job_id: str, status: str) -> None:
    """Update the status of a job."""
    if job_id in jobs:
        jobs[job_id]["status"] = status
        jobs[job_id]["updated_at"] = datetime.utcnow().isoformat()
        logger.info("Updated job status", job_id=job_id, status=status)

def add_job_result(job_id: str, result: Dict) -> None:
    """Add a result to a job and update the completed count."""
    if job_id in jobs:
        jobs[job_id]["results"].append(result)
        jobs[job_id]["completed_urls"] += 1
        jobs[job_id]["updated_at"] = datetime.utcnow().isoformat()
        
        # Check if job is complete
        if jobs[job_id]["completed_urls"] >= jobs[job_id]["total_urls"]:
            update_job_status(job_id, "completed")
        
        logger.info(
            "Added job result", 
            job_id=job_id, 
            url=result["url"], 
            status=result["status"],
            completed=jobs[job_id]["completed_urls"],
            total=jobs[job_id]["total_urls"]
        )
```

This implementation provides functions to create jobs, update their status, add results, and retrieve the current state of a job. The job store is a simple in-memory dictionary that maps job IDs to job data.

tasks.title: Implement Fetch Job Runner with Concurrency Control
tasks.description: Create the background task runner that processes fetch jobs with controlled concurrency using asyncio.Semaphore.
tasks.details:
Add the following functions to logic.py to implement the job runner with concurrency control:

```python
import asyncio
import random
from typing import List, Optional

from toolkit.browser import StealthBrowserToolkit

async def fetch_single_url_with_semaphore(
    url: str,
    semaphore: asyncio.Semaphore,
    proxies: List[str],
    wait_min: int,
    wait_max: int
) -> Dict:
    """Fetch a single URL with semaphore-controlled concurrency."""
    async with semaphore:
        # Select a random proxy if available
        proxy = random.choice(proxies) if proxies else None
        
        # Calculate random wait time within range
        wait_time = random.randint(wait_min, wait_max)
        
        logger.info(
            "Fetching URL with semaphore", 
            url=url, 
            proxy=proxy, 
            wait_time=wait_time
        )
        
        # Use the StealthBrowserToolkit to fetch the URL
        async with StealthBrowserToolkit(headless=True) as browser:
            result = await browser.fetch_url(url, proxy, wait_time)
        
        # Format the result according to our API model
        return {
            "url": url,
            "status": "success" if result["success"] else "error",
            "html_content": result["html"] if result["success"] else None,
            "error_message": result["error"] if not result["success"] else None
        }

async def run_fetching_job(job_id: str) -> None:
    """Run a fetching job as a background task."""
    if job_id not in jobs:
        logger.error("Job not found", job_id=job_id)
        return
    
    # Update job status to in_progress
    update_job_status(job_id, "in_progress")
    
    job = jobs[job_id]
    request_data = job["request"]
    
    try:
        # Extract options from the request
        links = request_data["links"]
        options = request_data["options"]
        
        proxies = options.get("proxies", [])
        wait_min = max(0, options.get("wait_min", 1))
        wait_max = max(wait_min, options.get("wait_max", 3))
        concurrency_limit = min(20, max(1, options.get("concurrency_limit", 5)))
        
        # Create a semaphore to limit concurrency
        semaphore = asyncio.Semaphore(concurrency_limit)
        
        # Create tasks for each URL
        tasks = [
            fetch_single_url_with_semaphore(url, semaphore, proxies, wait_min, wait_max)
            for url in links
        ]
        
        # Process URLs concurrently with controlled concurrency
        for task in asyncio.as_completed(tasks):
            try:
                result = await task
                add_job_result(job_id, result)
            except Exception as e:
                logger.error("Error processing URL", job_id=job_id, error=str(e))
                # Add a generic error result if we can't determine which URL failed
                error_result = {
                    "url": "unknown",
                    "status": "error",
                    "html_content": None,
                    "error_message": f"Unexpected error: {str(e)}"
                }
                add_job_result(job_id, error_result)
    
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error("Error running job", job_id=job_id, error=str(e))
        update_job_status(job_id, "failed")
```

This implementation provides a function to fetch a single URL with semaphore-controlled concurrency and a function to run a fetching job as a background task. The job runner extracts options from the request, creates a semaphore to limit concurrency, and processes URLs concurrently with controlled concurrency.

tasks.title: Implement /fetch/start Endpoint
tasks.description: Create the POST /fetch/start endpoint that accepts a FetchRequest, validates it, and initiates a background task.
tasks.details:
Update main.py to implement the /fetch/start endpoint:

```python
from fastapi import FastAPI, BackgroundTasks, HTTPException, Request
from fastapi.responses import JSONResponse

from api.models import FetchRequest, JobStatusResponse
from api.logic import create_job, run_fetching_job
from settings.logger import get_logger

logger = get_logger("api.endpoints")

@app.post("/fetch/start", response_model=JobStatusResponse)
async def start_fetch(request: FetchRequest, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks):
    """Start a new fetch job."""
    try:
        # Create a new job
        job_id = create_job(request)
        
        # Schedule the job to run in the background
        background_tasks.add_task(run_fetching_job, job_id)
        
        # Construct the status URL
        status_url = f"/fetch/status/{job_id}"
        
        logger.info("Started fetch job", job_id=job_id, url_count=len(request.links))
        
        # Return the job ID and status URL
        return JobStatusResponse(
            job_id=job_id,
            status_url=status_url
        )
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error("Error starting fetch job", error=str(e))
        raise HTTPException(status_code=500, detail=f"Error starting fetch job: {str(e)}")
```

This implementation creates a new job, schedules it to run in the background, and returns the job ID and status URL to the client.

#### **Field Validators**:
```python
@field_validator('links')
@classmethod
def validate_links(cls, v):
    """Validate URLs and detect duplicates."""
    validated_links = []
    seen_links = set()
    
    for link in v:
        # Check URL format - only HTTP/HTTPS supported
        if not link.startswith(('http://', 'https://')):
            raise ValueError(f'URL must start with http:// or https://: {link}')
        
        # Check for duplicates to avoid redundant processing
        if link in seen_links:
            raise ValueError(f'Duplicate URL found: {link}')
        
        seen_links.add(link)
        validated_links.append(link)
    
    return validated_links
```

### ðŸ”§ Validation Features:

tasks.title: Implement /fetch/status/{job_id} Endpoint
tasks.description: Create the GET /fetch/status/{job_id} endpoint to check job status and retrieve results.
tasks.details:
Update main.py to implement the /fetch/status/{job_id} endpoint:

```python
from fastapi import FastAPI, BackgroundTasks, HTTPException, Path

from api.models import FetchResponse
from api.logic import get_job_status
from settings.logger import get_logger

logger = get_logger("api.endpoints")

@app.get("/fetch/status/{job_id}", response_model=FetchResponse)
async def get_fetch_status(job_id: str = Path(..., description="The ID of the fetch job")):
    """Get the status of a fetch job."""
    try:
        # Get the job status
        job = get_job_status(job_id)
        
        if job is None:
            logger.warning("Job not found", job_id=job_id)
            raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail=f"Job with ID {job_id} not found")
        
        logger.info(
            "Retrieved job status", 
            job_id=job_id, 
            status=job.status, 
            completed=job.completed_urls,
            total=job.total_urls
        )
        
        return job
    except HTTPException:
        raise
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error("Error getting job status", job_id=job_id, error=str(e))
        raise HTTPException(status_code=500, detail=f"Error getting job status: {str(e)}")
```

This implementation retrieves the job status and returns it to the client. If the job is not found, it returns a 404 error.

tasks.title: Implement Random Proxy Selection
tasks.description: Enhance the fetching logic to randomly select proxies from the provided list for each request.
tasks.details:
The random proxy selection is already implemented in the `fetch_single_url_with_semaphore` function in task 21, but let's enhance it with better error handling and logging:

```python
async def fetch_single_url_with_semaphore(
    url: str,
    semaphore: asyncio.Semaphore,
    proxies: List[str],
    wait_min: int,
    wait_max: int,
    retry_count: int = 1
) -> Dict:
    """Fetch a single URL with semaphore-controlled concurrency and proxy rotation."""
    async with semaphore:
        # Try different proxies if retries are needed
        for attempt in range(retry_count + 1):
            # Select a random proxy if available
            proxy = random.choice(proxies) if proxies else None
            
            # Calculate random wait time within range
            wait_time = random.randint(wait_min, wait_max)
            
            logger.info(
                "Fetching URL with semaphore", 
                url=url, 
                proxy=proxy, 
                wait_time=wait_time,
                attempt=attempt + 1,
                max_attempts=retry_count + 1
            )
            
            try:
                # Use the StealthBrowserToolkit to fetch the URL
                async with StealthBrowserToolkit(headless=True) as browser:
                    result = await browser.fetch_url(url, proxy, wait_time)
                
                # If successful or this is the last attempt, return the result
                if result["success"] or attempt == retry_count:
                    # Format the result according to our API model
                    return {
                        "url": url,
                        "status": "success" if result["success"] else "error",
                        "html_content": result["html"] if result["success"] else None,
                        "error_message": result["error"] if not result["success"] else None
                    }
                
                # If we get here, the fetch failed but we have more retries
                logger.warning(
                    "Fetch failed, retrying with different proxy", 
                    url=url, 
                    error=result["error"],
                    attempt=attempt + 1,
                    max_attempts=retry_count + 1
                )
                
                # Wait before retrying
                await asyncio.sleep(wait_time)
            
            except Exception as e:
                # If this is the last attempt, raise the exception
                if attempt == retry_count:
                    logger.error(
                        "All fetch attempts failed", 
                        url=url, 
                        error=str(e),
                        attempts=retry_count + 1
                    )
                    return {
                        "url": url,
                        "status": "error",
                        "html_content": None,
                        "error_message": f"All fetch attempts failed: {str(e)}"
                    }
                
                # Otherwise, log and continue to the next attempt
                logger.warning(
                    "Fetch attempt failed, retrying", 
                    url=url, 
                    error=str(e),
                    attempt=attempt + 1,
                    max_attempts=retry_count + 1
                )
                
                # Wait before retrying
                await asyncio.sleep(wait_time)
```

Update the `run_fetching_job` function to pass the retry count:

```python

    # ... existing code ...

    ]

```

tasks.description: Enhance error handling to categorize common fetching errors for more structured error reporting.
tasks.details:
Update the StealthBrowserToolkit class to categorize common errors:

```python
class FetchError(Exception):
    """Base class for fetch errors."""
    pass

class TimeoutError(FetchError):
    """Error raised when a fetch operation times out."""
    pass

class NavigationError(FetchError):
    """Error raised when navigation fails."""
    pass

class CaptchaError(FetchError):
    """Error raised when a captcha is detected."""
    pass

class ProxyError(FetchError):
    """Error raised when there's an issue with the proxy."""
    pass

class StealthBrowserToolkit:
    # ... existing code ...
    
    async def fetch_url(self, url: str, proxy: Optional[str] = None, wait_time: int = 2) -> Dict[str, Union[str, bool]]:
        """Fetch a URL using a stealth browser and return the HTML content."""
        result = {
            "url": url,
            "success": False,
            "html": None,
            "error": None,
            "error_type": None
        }
        
        context = None
        page = None
        
        try:
            self.logger.info("Fetching URL", url=url, proxy=proxy)
            context = await self.create_context(proxy)
            page = await context.new_page()
            
            # Set timeout for navigation
            page.set_default_navigation_timeout(30000)  # 30 seconds
            
            # Navigate to the URL
            try:
                response = await page.goto(url, wait_until="networkidle")
            except Exception as e:
                if "timeout" in str(e).lower():
                    raise TimeoutError(f"Navigation timed out: {str(e)}")
                elif "proxy" in str(e).lower():
                    raise ProxyError(f"Proxy error: {str(e)}")
                else:
                    raise NavigationError(f"Navigation failed: {str(e)}")
            
            if not response:
                raise NavigationError("No response received from the server")
            
            if response.status >= 400:
                raise NavigationError(f"HTTP error: {response.status}")
            
            # Wait for the page to be fully loaded
            await asyncio.sleep(wait_time)
            
            # Check for common captcha patterns
            content = await page.content()
            if any(pattern in content.lower() for pattern in ["captcha", "robot", "human verification"]):
                raise CaptchaError("Captcha detected on the page")
            
            # Get the HTML content
            result["html"] = content
            result["success"] = True
            
            self.logger.info("Successfully fetched URL", url=url, content_length=len(content))
            return result
            
        except FetchError as e:
            error_message = str(e)
            error_type = e.__class__.__name__
            self.logger.error("Fetch error", url=url, error_type=error_type, error=error_message)
            result["error"] = error_message
            result["error_type"] = error_type
            return result
            
        except Exception as e:
            error_message = str(e)
            self.logger.error("Unexpected error fetching URL", url=url, error=error_message)
            result["error"] = error_message
            result["error_type"] = "UnexpectedError"
            return result
            
        finally:
            # Clean up resources
            if page:
                await page.close()
            if context:
                await context.close()
```

        "Starting fetch job", 
        job_id=job_id, 
        url_count=len(links),

3. Add request ID tracking in the middleware:
```python
@app.middleware("http")
async def log_requests(request, call_next):
    import uuid
    request_id = str(uuid.uuid4())
    from settings.logger import log_request_context
    log_request_context(request_id, request.headers.get("user-agent"))
    
    # Add the request ID to the response headers
    response = await call_next(request)
    response.headers["X-Request-ID"] = request_id
    
    return response
```

4. Add performance metrics logging:
```python
class PerformanceMetrics:
    """Track performance metrics for the application."""
    
    def __init__(self):
        self.fetch_durations = []
        self.job_durations = []
    
    def record_fetch_duration(self, duration_ms: float):
        self.fetch_durations.append(duration_ms)
        
        # Log statistics periodically
        if len(self.fetch_durations) % 10 == 0:
            self._log_fetch_stats()
    
    def record_job_duration(self, duration_ms: float):
        self.job_durations.append(duration_ms)
        self._log_job_stats()
    
    def _log_fetch_stats(self):
        if not self.fetch_durations:
            return
            
        avg_duration = sum(self.fetch_durations) / len(self.fetch_durations)
        max_duration = max(self.fetch_durations)
        min_duration = min(self.fetch_durations)
        
        logger.info(
            "Fetch performance metrics", 
            avg_duration_ms=round(avg_duration, 2),
            max_duration_ms=round(max_duration, 2),
            min_duration_ms=round(min_duration, 2),
            sample_size=len(self.fetch_durations)
        )
    
    def _log_job_stats(self):
        if not self.job_durations:
            return
            
        avg_duration = sum(self.job_durations) / len(self.job_durations)
        max_duration = max(self.job_durations)
        min_duration = min(self.job_durations)
        
        logger.info(
            "Job performance metrics", 
            avg_duration_ms=round(avg_duration, 2),
            max_duration_ms=round(max_duration, 2),
            min_duration_ms=round(min_duration, 2),
            sample_size=len(self.job_durations)
        )

# Create a singleton instance
performance_metrics = PerformanceMetrics()
```

import pytest
from pydantic import ValidationError
from api.models import FetchRequest, FetchOptions, FetchResult

def test_fetch_options_validation():
    # Test valid options
    options = FetchOptions(
        proxies=["http://proxy.example.com:8080"],
        wait_min=1,
        wait_max=3,
        concurrency_limit=5
    )
    assert options.proxies == ["http://proxy.example.com:8080"]
    assert options.wait_min == 1
    assert options.wait_max == 3
    assert options.concurrency_limit == 5
    
    # Test default values
    options = FetchOptions()
    assert options.proxies == []
    assert options.wait_min == 1
    assert options.wait_max == 3
    assert options.concurrency_limit == 5
    
    # Test invalid wait_max
    with pytest.raises(ValidationError):
        FetchOptions(wait_min=3, wait_max=1)
    
    # Test invalid proxy format
    with pytest.raises(ValidationError):
        FetchOptions(proxies=["invalid-proxy"])

def test_fetch_request_validation():
    # Test valid request
    request = FetchRequest(
        links=["https://example.com"],
        options=FetchOptions()
    )
    assert request.links == ["https://example.com"]
    assert isinstance(request.options, FetchOptions)
    
    # Test empty links
    with pytest.raises(ValidationError):
        FetchRequest(links=[])
    
    # Test invalid URL
    with pytest.raises(ValidationError):
        FetchRequest(links=["not-a-url"])
```

Implement unit tests for logic:

```python
import pytest
from api.logic import create_job, get_job_status, update_job_status, add_job_result, jobs

def test_create_job(sample_fetch_request):
    job_id = create_job(sample_fetch_request)
    assert job_id in jobs
    assert jobs[job_id]["status"] == "pending"
    assert jobs[job_id]["total_urls"] == len(sample_fetch_request.links)
    assert jobs[job_id]["completed_urls"] == 0

def test_get_job_status(sample_job_id):
    status = get_job_status(sample_job_id)
    assert status.job_id == sample_job_id
    assert status.status == "pending"
    assert status.results == []
    assert status.total_urls == 1
    assert status.completed_urls == 0
    
    # Test non-existent job
    assert get_job_status("non-existent-id") is None

def test_update_job_status(sample_job_id):
    update_job_status(sample_job_id, "in_progress")
    assert jobs[sample_job_id]["status"] == "in_progress"
    
    status = get_job_status(sample_job_id)
    assert status.status == "in_progress"

def test_add_job_result(sample_job_id):
    result = {
        "url": "https://example.com",
        "status": "success",
        "html_content": "<html></html>",
        "error_message": None
    }
    
    add_job_result(sample_job_id, result)
    assert jobs[sample_job_id]["completed_urls"] == 1
    assert len(jobs[sample_job_id]["results"]) == 1
    assert jobs[sample_job_id]["results"][0] == result
    
    # Test that job status is updated to completed when all URLs are processed
    assert jobs[sample_job_id]["status"] == "completed"
```

import pytest
from fastapi.testclient import TestClient

def test_start_fetch(test_client, sample_fetch_request):
    response = test_client.post(
        "/fetch/start",
        json=sample_fetch_request.dict()
    )
    
    assert response.status_code == 200
    data = response.json()
    assert "job_id" in data
    assert "status_url" in data
    assert data["status_url"] == f"/fetch/status/{data['job_id']}"

def test_get_fetch_status(test_client, sample_job_id):
    response = test_client.get(f"/fetch/status/{sample_job_id}")
    
    assert response.status_code == 200
    data = response.json()
    assert data["job_id"] == sample_job_id
    assert data["status"] == "pending"
    assert data["results"] == []
    assert data["total_urls"] == 1
    assert data["completed_urls"] == 0
    
    # Test non-existent job
    response = test_client.get("/fetch/status/00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000")
    assert response.status_code == 404

    - Configurable concurrency limits
    - Proxy rotation
    - Detailed error reporting
    - Job status tracking
    
    ## Usage
    
    1. Submit a fetch job using the `/fetch/start` endpoint
    2. Check the job status using the `/fetch/status/{job_id}` endpoint
    """,
    version="1.0.0",
    docs_url="/docs",
    redoc_url="/redoc"
)

# Customize OpenAPI schema
def custom_openapi():
    if app.openapi_schema:
        return app.openapi_schema
    
    openapi_schema = get_openapi(
        title=app.title,
        version=app.version,
        description=app.description,
        routes=app.routes,
    )
    
    # Add examples
    openapi_schema["components"]["schemas"]["FetchRequest"]["example"] = {
        "links": ["https://example.com", "https://example.org"],
        "options": {
            "proxies": ["http://proxy1.example.com:8080", "http://proxy2.example.com:8080"],
            "wait_min": 1,
            "wait_max": 3,
            "concurrency_limit": 5
        }
    }
    
    openapi_schema["components"]["schemas"]["JobStatusResponse"]["example"] = {
        "job_id": "123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000",
        "status_url": "/fetch/status/123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000"
    }
    
    openapi_schema["components"]["schemas"]["FetchResponse"]["example"] = {
        "job_id": "123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000",
        "status": "completed",
        "results": [
            {
                "url": "https://example.com",
                "status": "success",
                "html_content": "<html><body>Example content</body></html>",
                "error_message": None,
                "error_type": None
            },
            {
                "url": "https://example.org",
                "status": "error",
                "html_content": None,
                "error_message": "Navigation failed: HTTP 404",
                "error_type": "NavigationError"
            }
        ],
        "total_urls": 2,
        "completed_urls": 2
    }
    
    app.openapi_schema = openapi_schema
    return app.openapi_schema

app.openapi = custom_openapi
```

Add a README.md file to the project root with usage instructions:

```markdown
# Async Web Fetching Service

A service for asynchronously fetching web content using stealth browsers.

## Features

- Asynchronous fetching of multiple URLs
- Configurable concurrency limits
- Proxy rotation
- Detailed error reporting
- Job status tracking

## Requirements

- Python 3.13+
- Patchright browser installed via `patchright install`

## Installation

```bash
# Clone the repository
git clone https://github.com/yourusername/async-web-fetcher.git
cd async-web-fetcher

# Create a virtual environment
python -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate  # On Windows: venv\Scripts\activate

# Install dependencies
pip install -r requirements.txt

# Install Patchright browser
patchright install
```

## Usage

```bash
# Start the server
uvicorn api.main:app --host 0.0.0.0 --port 8000 --reload
```

The API will be available at http://localhost:8000.

### API Documentation

Interactive API documentation is available at http://localhost:8000/docs.

### Example Usage

```python
import requests
import time

# Start a fetch job
response = requests.post(
    "http://localhost:8000/fetch/start",
    json={
        "links": ["https://example.com", "https://example.org"],
        "options": {
            "proxies": ["http://proxy1.example.com:8080", "http://proxy2.example.com:8080"],
            "wait_min": 1,
            "wait_max": 3,
            "concurrency_limit": 5
        }
    }
)

job_data = response.json()
job_id = job_data["job_id"]
status_url = job_data["status_url"]

print(f"Job ID: {job_id}")
print(f"Status URL: {status_url}")

# Poll for job status
while True:
    response = requests.get(f"http://localhost:8000{status_url}")
    status_data = response.json()
    
    print(f"Status: {status_data['status']}")
    print(f"Completed: {status_data['completed_urls']}/{status_data['total_urls']}")
    
    if status_data["status"] in ["completed", "failed"]:
        break
    
    time.sleep(1)

# Print results
for result in status_data["results"]:
    print(f"URL: {result['url']}")
    print(f"Status: {result['status']}")
    if result["status"] == "success":
        print(f"Content length: {len(result['html_content'])}")
    else:
        print(f"Error: {result['error_message']}")
    print()
```

Create a Dockerfile in the project root:

```dockerfile
# Use Python 3.13 as the base image
FROM python:3.13-slim

# Set working directory
WORKDIR /app

# Install system dependencies
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y \
    wget \
    gnupg \
    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# Install Patchright (assuming it's a package that can be installed via pip)
# If it requires a different installation method, adjust accordingly
RUN pip install patchright
RUN patchright install

# Copy requirements and install Python dependencies
COPY requirements.txt .
RUN pip install --no-cache-dir -r requirements.txt

# Copy the application code
COPY . .

# Expose the port the app runs on
EXPOSE 8000

# Command to run the application
CMD ["uvicorn", "api.main:app", "--host", "0.0.0.0", "--port", "8000"]
```
